text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with spicy pork and vegetable tofu
that's right welcome to another episode
of recipes i make for dinner when i have
no idea what to make for dinner and for
edition end up on that list it has to
check off all the right boxes right it
has to be fast and easy and it has to
look good and taste good as well as be
healthy although the last one is
optional but the point is this is one of
those recipes that i think has it all in
fact the only problem with this is
people are gonna think i'm trying to
make Mapo tofu but i'm not okay that
might have inspired this a little bit
but it is quite different as you're
about to see and we'll go ahead and get
started by mixing up our sauce and
that'll begin by adding a generous
amount of Korean chili paste to this
bowl which goes by a name something
close to gochujang and as usual I'll
give a few more details about the more
exotic ingredients in the blogpost and
then to that we will add some hoisin
sauce followed by a little squirt of
that classic Chinese ingredient tomato
ketchup we are also gonna want a very
generous splash of rice vinegar and by
the way I'm using seasoned rice vinegar
which already has a little bit of salt
and sugar in it so if you're using
regular rice vinegar or a different
vinegar you may want to sneak in a spoon
of sugar we will also go ahead and add a
splash of soy sauce as well as a little
drizzle of sesame oil and then we'll
finish this up with some finely minced
or crushed garlic as well as the spoon
of freshly grated ginger and that's
going to be it we'll go ahead and take a
whisk and give this a mix and set it
aside
at which point we'll move on to prep our
zucchini and the first step for that
would be to cube these up so what we'll
do after cutting off the ends and
splitting this and half lengthwise is
that we'll go ahead and cut that twice
the long way to make hopefully three
equally sized long strips which we can
then turn and simply cut across an
equally sized cubes and don't take this
personally but I really don't care how
big you make your cubes as long as you
pick a size and stick with it
so that hopefully these all cook evenly
and then what we're gonna do once our
zucchini is cut is that it to a bowl and
toss it with a tablespoon of kosher salt
which looks like a lot and it kind of is
but we're gonna rinse most of that off
after giving this stuff what I'm calling
a quick here
because what's gonna happen after we mix
this up is we're gonna let it sit for
like 10 to 15 minutes and that's how
it's gonna drought a shocking amount of
water from the zucchini in fact this
shot right here was only like a minute
after I added the salt and you can
already see how wet it's looking and
then what we'll do after about 10 or 15
minutes is go ahead and drain this and
you can see just how much liquid was
extracted and then what we should
probably do at this point is give these
a thorough rinsing and let them sit and
drain until we need them and by the way
before you rinse go ahead and taste one
because if that tasted perfectly
seasoned to you do not rinse it but most
likely it will taste a little salty so
we'll go ahead and rinse those off and
basically by drawing out that liquid
we've intensified and sweetened the
flavor of the vegetable and as you'll
experience later we've really improved
the texture and we'll go ahead and let
that drain while we move on to the next
step which is to brown our ground pork
over high heat in a dry pan okay there's
gonna be enough fat in that pork we
don't have to add any more here and what
we'll do is cook that on high heat for
about five or six minutes or so not only
as I said to brown the meat but we also
at the same time want to break this up
and do a small pieces as we can all
right the smaller the better I think and
then what we'll do after our pork has
been cooked and crumbled is go ahead and
add some mince spicy red peppers but not
just any pepper for I believe the first
time in food wishes history we're gonna
be using fresh cayenne pepper yes this
is what Cayenne looks like before it
ends up in your spice shaker and what
I'd like to do here is slice it very
thin and then sort of seed it all right
using kind of a lazy man's technique
where you sort of slice the pepper up
and then give it a little bit of a toss
which causes all the seeds to sort of
fall out and then what we'll do is
separate most of those and then go ahead
and chop up the pepper as first heat
goes these aren't super super super hot
all right definitely more than a
jalapeno or a Fresno but not as how does
a habanero so somewhere in between and
once we have that all minced up we will
add that to our pork along with a nice
big handful of sliced scallions mostly
the white and light parts and we will
stir that all together and we'll go
ahead and cook that for another minute
or so and we'll continue to break up any
large clumps of meat if we see them and
then what we'll do at this point is
reduce our heat to medium and we'll go
ahead and add our sauce and stir it in
and I should mention at this point I'm
not gonna serve this over rice I'm just
gonna eat it as is but if you were to
serve this over rice you may want to
consider doubling the sauce amount so
that you do have extra to account for
that but anyway we'll go ahead and mix
that up and what we'll do is let this
cook for a few minutes on medium while
we prep our final major ingredients our
tofu which by the way is sold in many
different forms and today I'll be using
the firm variety although it can be a
little confusing when you go to the
store cuz there's many different kinds
of firm right there's regular firm
there's extra firm they're super firm
there's ultra firm and I think there's
even one called if you have to ask it's
too firm for you but anyway like I said
I'm using regular firm and as you can
see I'm cubing it up by cutting slices
and then strips and then turning and
cutting across into cubes very similar
to what we just did with our zucchini
okay culinary knife skills have as much
to do with geometry as they do with
hand-eye coordination and yes doing two
slices at once is twice as fast as doing
one at a time and what we'll do once
that set is go ahead and add that to our
pork along with our rinsed and now very
well drained zucchini and we'll go ahead
and stir all that together starting off
slowly otherwise you'll knock it all out
of the pan he said from experience and
then what we'll do once this is all
combined is simply continue cooking
stirring very often until our vegetables
are tender and how long that's going to
take exactly depends on which vegetables
you used and how big you cut them but
the good news is you don't need a
cooking time for something like this
because when you think you're getting
close like I did right here you're
simply gonna taste one or two to check
and mine were right exactly where I
wanted him and my favorite term to
describe that would be crisp tender
which means they are tender and not
wrong crunchy but there is still just a
little bit of crisp texture to the bite
and a lot of that has to do with that
salt curing we did earlier and then what
we'll do once we've determined our
vegetables have cooked long enough is go
ahead and turn off the heat and we'll go
ahead and stir in some fresh herb if
we're using it so I'm gonna go ahead and
stir in some freshly chopped cilantro
but if you're not into that leave it out
or maybe try something like Thai basil
that would be good here but anyway if
you're using herbs we'll go ahead and
stir them in and of course we'll give
that one last taste for season
and mine was tasting just about right so
we'll go ahead and serve up and I
garnished with some extra sliced cayenne
pepper so people know we're not fooling
around and I finished that up a little
touch of green onion and that's it what
I'm calling spicy pork and vegetable
tofu is done so let me go ahead and grab
that spoon and dig in and of course if
you prefer a fork or chopsticks use
those
I mean you are for all the Foo Manchu of
how to chew your tofu but personally I
do find the spoon the best delivery
system but no matter what you use I
think you're going to be very very
impressed with this dish okay it's one
of those recipes where you can identify
and taste each of the individual
ingredients and yet they still blend
beautifully together to form a
harmonious amalgamation and no you're
not going to miss the rice at all in
fact I think it actually dilutes the
flavor but like I said if you are gonna
serve this over rice you're definitely
gonna need to make more sauce oh and one
last thing before we sign off I called
this pork and vegetable tofu in not pork
and zucchini tofu for a reason since
this is one of those recipes it's
absolutely perfect to act as a catch-all
for all your seasonal produce all right
things like green beans or eggplant or
peppers or other kinds of summer squash
should all work beautifully in this and
once you get a little bit of that slice
and dice and cubed out of the way it
really is a fast and easy recipe but
anyway that's it spicy pork and
vegetable tofu like I said when I'm
sitting around and I cannot decide what
to make for dinner very often this is
what I end up making and I am never not
glad I did so I really do hope you give
this a try soon head over to food wishes
comm for all the ingredient amounts of
more info as usual and as always enjoy
you
you
